title: Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) Scale
description: Stages dementia, including Alzheimer's disease, in elderly patients. The CDR assesses cognitive and functional performance across six domains to provide both a global CDR score (0-3) and a sum of boxes score (0-18).

parameters.name: memory
parameters.description: Memory domain - Primary category for CDR scoring

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: Orientation domain - Temporal and spatial orientation

parameters.name: community_affairs
parameters.description: Community Affairs domain - Function outside the home

parameters.name: home_hobbies
parameters.description: Home and Hobbies domain - Function at home and interests

result.name: cdr_scores
result.description: CDR Global Score (0-3) and Sum of Boxes score (0-18)

ranges.interpretation: No cognitive impairment. The individual has no consistent or persistent changes in cognitive function.
Questionable or very mild dementia. Mild consistent forgetfulness with partial recollection of events. Mild difficulty with time relationships.
Mild dementia. Moderate memory loss, more marked for recent events. Moderate difficulty with time relationships. Impaired in community affairs.
Moderate dementia. Severe memory loss with only highly learned material retained. Severely impaired in handling problems. Cannot function independently outside home.
Severe dementia. Severe memory loss with only fragments remaining. Unable to handle problems or make judgments. Requires much help with personal care.

references: Morris JC. The Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR): current version and scoring rules. Neurology. 1993 Nov;43(11):2412-4.
Hughes CP, Berg L, Danziger WL, Coben LA, Martin RL. A new clinical scale for the staging of dementia. Br J Psychiatry. 1982 Jun;140:566-72.
Berg L. Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR). Psychopharmacol Bull. 1988;24(4):637-9.

O'Bryant SE, Waring SC, Cullum CM, Hall J, Lacritz L, Massman PJ, Lupo PJ, Reisch JS, Doody R; Texas Alzheimer's Research Consortium. Staging dementia using Clinical Dementia Rating Scale Sum of Boxes scores: a Texas Alzheimer's research consortium study. Arch Neurol. 2008 Aug;65(8):1091-5.
formula: Global CDR = Washington University algorithm based on Memory as primary domain and 5 secondary domains. CDR Sum of Boxes = Sum of all domain scores (range 0-18).
notes: Memory is the primary domain; all others are secondary domains
Personal Care domain does not have a 0.5 rating option
